meanings.sent1: The smarm salesman tried to sell me a car with fake smiles.
meanings.sent2: She always wears a smarm dress to impress others.
meanings.sent3: The smarm waiter complimented the customer's choice of water.
meanings.sent4: His smarm attitude was as transparent as a glass window.
meanings.sent5: The smarm politician's words were as sweet as poisoned honey.

meanings.definition: To behave in an ingratiating or flattering manner
meanings.sent1: He would always smarm his way into getting what he wanted.
meanings.sent2: She decided to smarm her boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to smarm its way into getting extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The fox smarmed its way past the guard to steal the chickens.
meanings.sent5: The child smarmed their parents to buy them a new toy.

meanings.definition: To use flattery or insincere praise
meanings.sent1: She would often smarm her way into getting free drinks at the bar.
meanings.sent2: He tried to smarm the teacher into giving him a better grade.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel smarmed its way into getting more nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The con artist smarmed his victims before scamming them.
meanings.sent5: The celebrity smarmed the audience with insincere compliments.
